scenarioDescription:
The HD 38801 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 38801 is a star with 1.21 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.03 times its radius. It is located 298.22 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.072 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 38801 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 38801 system


HD 38801 b

HD 38801 b was discovered by the Subaru Telescope observatory, in 2010-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.62 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 38801 b is 3083.964 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 38801 b is 12.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 38801 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 38801, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Subaru Telescope.
name: HD 38801 - System With 1 Exoplanet
